name: e2e
description: Builds and serves an Angular app, then runs end-to-end tests using Protractor.
longDescription:
Must be executed from within a workspace directory.
When a project name is not supplied, it will execute for all projects.

options.name: project
options.description: The name of the project to build. Can be an application or a library.

options.name: configuration
options.description:
One or more named builder configurations as a comma-separated list as specified in the "configurations" section of angular.json.
The builder uses the named configurations to run the given target.
For more information, see https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#alternate-build-configurations.
Setting this explicitly overrides the "--prod" flag.

options.name: prod
options.description:
Shorthand for "--configuration=production".
Set the build configuration to the production target.
By default, the production target is set up in the workspace configuration such that all builds make use of bundling, limited tree-shaking, and also limited dead code elimination.

options.name: help
options.description: Shows a help message for this command in the console.

options.name: protractor-config
options.description: The name of the Protractor configuration file.

options.name: dev-server-target
options.description: A dev-server builder target to run tests against in the format of `project:target[:configuration]`. You can also pass in more than one configuration name as a comma-separated list. Example: `project:target:production,staging`.

options.name: grep
options.description: Execute specs whose names match the pattern, which is internally compiled to a RegExp.

options.name: invert-grep
options.description: Invert the selection specified by the 'grep' option.

options.name: specs
options.description: Override specs in the protractor config.

options.name: suite
options.description: Override suite in the protractor config.

options.name: port
options.description: The port to use to serve the application.

options.name: base-url
options.description: Base URL for protractor to connect to.
